sentence.text: Loss of GLIS3 function in humans and epidermis development leads to the development of several pathologies, including neonatal diabetes and congenital hypothyroidism, polycystic kidney disease, and infertility.

Single nucleotide polymorphisms in GLIS3 genes have been associated with increased risk of several diseases, including muscle organ development 1 and type 2 diabetes, glaucoma, and neurological disorders.
